isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - ENGINE ELECTRICAL - Cleaning and Inspection

step1.para: Carefully inspect wiring harness for worn conduit, frayed insulation or heat damage on wires. Repair or replace if necessary.
Inspect sensor and valve connectors for cracked connector bodies, bent pins, chaffing, and damaged or missing O-rings. Replace connectors if necessary. Replace O-rings if necessary.
Inspect each connector for the following conditions and replace, if necessary:

item.para: Corroded connectors (green or gray) and white deposits on metal terminals.
Terminals incorrectly latched in connector body or pushed back relative to other terminals in same connector.

Make sure that each connector has its ribbed seal in place. During disassembly, a ribbed seal may pull off of its connector and remain in the mating socket of a sensor or actuator. A connector assembled without the correct ribbed seal can be contaminated with moisture and have corroded terminals, causing a poor electrical connection.

step1.para: Check engine wiring harness connectors, connector covers, seals, and cover shields for cracks, cuts or worn areas. Replace if necessary.
